posts.title: Alternative Valentine's Reading
posts.text: If you are in need of some literary angst on this typically romantic holiday, here are some ideas to get you started.

posts.title: Beginnings in Endings: Books for the New Year
posts.text: As we approach the closing of one year and the opening of another, here are a few books whose ends (to paraphrase T. S. Eliot) contain their beginnings.

posts.title: The Bronx Goes to Hollywood: Anne Bancroft
posts.text: In addition to the many classic movies set in the Big Apple, there have been many Hollywood stars who began their lives in New York.

posts.title: The Bronx Goes to Hollywood: Neil Simon
posts.text: To celebrate the Bronxites who have found success in Hollywood, Parkchester Library will be viewing films starring, written by, or directed by men and women who were born in our borough.

posts.title: Alternative Halloween Reads
posts.text: if you are tired of the more typical scary classics, check out some alternative options for Halloween reading.

posts.title: Political Reads: Tackle one of these Masterpieces this Election Season
posts.text: If election coverage has not already exhausted the political portions of your brain, head to the NYPL and check out some great works of literature that wrestle with questions about government, law, and the complexities of human society. Here are some suggestions to get you started.
